meanings.definition: To defeat or get the better of by superior cleverness; outsmart.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outwit her opponent in the chess game.
meanings.sent2: The detective was able to outwit the criminal and solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox tried to outwit the farmer by pretending to be injured.
meanings.sent4: In the game of wits, she always knew how to outwit her competitors.
meanings.sent5: His ability to outwit others made him a formidable opponent.
